title: Battlefield 6 Winter Offensive Event Pass - How To Unlock Ice Climbing Axe And All Rewards
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                Season 1's new Winter Offensive update is live in...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Season 1's new Winter Offensive update is live in Battlefield 6. This update introduces a new melee weapon and the icy winter variant of the Empire State map called Ice Lock Empire State.In this guide, we'll show you how to unlock all the free and paid items in Battlefield 6's Winter Offensive event pass, including the new Nomad CX-12 ice climbing axe.Battlefield 6's Winter Offensive event pass is a bonus reward path separate from the game's Season 1 battle pass, but you'll still find it under the battle pass tab in the menus. This event pass includes 11 tiers of free and premium items to unlock, meaning you'll need to purchase the $10 Season 1 premium battle pass to earn them all.Just like the recent California Resistance event pass, you level up in the event by earning battle pass points, and this will level up alongside your active path in the Season 1 battle pass. Points are earned by completing weekly challenges and earning XP, and you reach a new reward tier for every 10 battle pass points you earn.The Winter Offensive event pass is available to complete between now and December 22. The full list of event rewards can be found below, including an operator skin, vehicle skin, and other winter-themed cosmetics. The skins are part of the premium rewards, but the Nomad CX-12 ice climbing axe is one of the free items you unlock.The full patch notes for the Winter Offensive update can be found here, which detail audio improvements and several quality-of-life updates.

title: Magic: The Gathering Marvel Super Heroes Card Reveal Includes A Very Powerful Hulk
description: By     Jason Fanelli   on December 9, 2025 at 12:10PM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from...
body:
By 
    Jason Fanelli
   on December 9, 2025 at 12:10PM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Marvel Super Heroes assemble!Wizards of the Coast has a full slate of expansions for Magic: The Gathering coming in 2026, starting with a return to a fan-favorite plane in January with Lorwyn: Eclipsed. June, however, will bring Marvel Super Heroes, a set themed around the many heroes and villains of the Marvel universe, and today, Wizards of the Coast previewed a few cards that will be appearing in that superhero set. Familiar faces like Captain America, The Incredible Hulk, and Doctor Doom were previewed during an hour-long livestream, along with the reveal of the Fantastic Four as the main focus of one of the expansion's preconstructed Commander decks. The stream also revealed multiple art variants, including Classic Comic alternates for Captain America, Doctor Doom, Hulk, and Namor; borderless comic panel alternates like those found in the recent Spider-Man set; and a new batch of Source Material bonus sheet cards, which include reprints of Dauthi Voidwalker, Massacre Girl, and more adorned with classic Marvel art. Magic: The Gathering's Marvel Super Hero set is due to launch June 2026 in both local game stores and big box retailers. The gallery below showcases all of the cards shown during the WOTC livestream today. Baron Helmut ZenoBruce Banner (double-faced card, front side)The Incredible Hulk (double-faced card, back side)Bruce Banner (Classic Comic variant, front side)The Incredible Hulk (Classic Comic variant, back side)Captain America, Super-SoldierCaptain America, Super-Soldier (Classic Comic variant)Doctor DoomDoctor Doom (Classic Comic variant)Doom Reigns SupremeMoon Girl and Devil DinosaurNamor the Sub-MarinerNamor the Sub-Mariner (Classic Comic variant)Quicksilver, Brash BlurSuper-SkrullThe Coming of GalactusThe Coming of Galactus (Borderless Panel variant)The Sentry, Golden GuardianThunderbolts ConspiracyWorld War HulkWorld War Hulk (Borderless Panel variant)Mister Fantastic (Commander precon face commander)Invisible Woman (Commander precon face commander)Human Torch (Commander precon face commander)The Thing (Commander precon face commander)Chaos Warp (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Widow-Making Infiltrator (Source Material bonus sheet reprint of Dauthi Voidwalker)Dig Through Time (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Ephemerate (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Extinction Event (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Force of Vigor (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Note: this card was captured from a livestream, and we will update with a hi-res version in the future.Harbinger of the Seas (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Heroic Intervention (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Heroic Intervention (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Heroic Intervention (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Lord of Atlantis (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Horn of Greed (Source Material bonus sheet reprint)Note: this card was captured from a livestream, and we will update with a hi-res version in the future.Elektra, Deadly Assassin (Source Material bonus sheet reprint of Massacre Girl)

title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Is Giving Away A Very Big Charizard
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          The Pokemon Company is giving...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                The Pokemon Company is giving away another free gift for Pokemon Legends: Z-A players. Ahead of the game's Mega Dimension DLC, you can snag a mighty alpha Charizard for a limited time.On top of being much larger than a typical Charizard, this particular Pokemon is level 36 and knows Solar Beam--a move Charizard normally can only learn via TM. This should make it a helpful partner to have on your team when facing off against the overleveled Pokemon that reside in Hyperspace Lumiose.          To claim the free alpha Charizard, fire up your copy of Pokemon Legends: Z-A and do the following:Press X to open the menuSelect Link PlaySelect Mystery GiftChoose Get with Code/PasswordInput the code B1G006 and download the giftSave your gameThis code will only be valid until January 19, 2026, so you have until then to claim the free Pokemon.This isn't the only free gift you can get right now in Pokemon Legends: Z-A. The Pokemon Company is also giving away Mega Stones for Diancie and Mewtwo. Once you've claimed the stones and cleared the main story, you can undertake special side quests to catch the two legendary Pokemon.Pokemon Legends: Z-A's Mega Dimension DLC launches on December 10. This expansion adds new story content that takes Team MZ into Hyperspace Lumiose, an alternate dimension where players will encounter wild Pokemon over level 100. The DLC also introduces a handful of new Mega Evolutions like Mega Zeraora and Mega Lucario Z.
